Description: Lower wall sherd of South Ionian pottery little-master cup; interior glazed; exterior: alternating reserved and black bands.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type (possibly)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels regarding the exterior decoration, see Alexandria 17224, which Venit suggests comes from the same vessel. For parallels regarding the decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346). Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the shape and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 51, no. 174 pl. 41)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 258)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.754) (Phase 3)
